A. 2, 407</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyias: <entryFree id="n48259" type="main" key="Thy_ia^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳiăs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*quia/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*qua/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 92</bibl>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳiădes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchantes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:514" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:791" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 791</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyinus: <entryFree id="n48260" type="main" key="thy_i^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/i+nos,</foreign> <sense id="n48260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of the citrus-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 18, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyle: <entryFree id="n48261" type="main" key="Thy_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Thule.</entryFree>
thymbra: <entryFree id="n48262" type="greek" key="thymbra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/mbra,</foreign> <sense id="n48262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi>: Satureia hortensis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10:233" default="NO">9, 10, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48263" type="main" key="Thymbra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymbra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymbrē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qu/mbrh,</foreign> <sense id="n48263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl> (dub.; al. Cambre); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 22</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48263.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thym-braeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Thymbræan</hi>, an epithet of <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n48263.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymbrae-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">another name for the</hi> sisymbrium silvestre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91, § 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymela: <entryFree id="n48264" type="greek" key="thy^me^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qume/lh,</foreign> <sense id="n48264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevation in the centre of the orchestra of a Greek theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of an altar</hi>, upon which stood the leader of the chorus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 7, 21; Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Ant. p. 148.</sense></entryFree>
thymelaea: <entryFree id="n48265" type="greek" key="thy^me^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qume/laia,</foreign> <sense id="n48265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the flax - leaved daphne</hi>: Daphne Gnidium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 35, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymele: <entryFree id="n48266" type="main" key="Thy^me^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thymĕlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated female dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:197" default="NO">8, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymelicus: <entryFree id="n48267" type="greek" key="thy^me^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qumeliko/s.</foreign> <sense id="n48267.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> thymele or <hi rend="ital">to the orchestra;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">thy-mĕlĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical musicians</hi> (opp. scaenici, actors), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48267.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., = scaenicus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the theatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">choragium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282</bibl></cit>: Thymelica obscenitas, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin. — Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48267.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thy-mĕlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an actor</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 7, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2589</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48267.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĕlĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an actress</hi>, Cod. Th. 15, 7, 5.</sense></entryFree>
thymiama: <entryFree id="n48268" type="greek" key="thy_mi^a_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳmĭāma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qumi/ama,</foreign> <sense id="n48268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a composition for fumigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymiamaterium: <entryFree id="n48269" type="main" key="thy_mi^a_ma^te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳmĭāmătērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>thymiama</etym>, <sense id="n48269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a censer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vessel for incense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:52:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 52, 19</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">thȳmātērĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 4, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymiamus: <entryFree id="n48270" type="spur" key="thy^mi^a^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĭămus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 10</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
thyminus: <entryFree id="n48271" type="greek" key="thy^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/minos,</foreign> <sense id="n48271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of thyme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of thyme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:33:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. thymosus.</sense></entryFree>
thymion: <entryFree id="n48272" type="greek" key="thy^mi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/mion,</foreign> <sense id="n48272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 45, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymites: <entryFree id="n48273" type="greek" key="thy^mi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qumi/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n48273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thyme-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thymosus: <entryFree id="n48274" type="main" key="thy^mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>thymum</etym>, <sense id="n48274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of thyme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thymy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>; cf. thyminus. <cb n="TIAR" /></sense></entryFree>
thymum: <entryFree id="n48275" type="greek" key="thy^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thymum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/mon,</foreign> <sense id="n48275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thyme</hi> (both the common or Roman, Thymus vulgaris, Linn., and the Cretan or Greek, Satureia capitata, ib.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 80</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:272" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:42:4 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 42, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
thyni: <entryFree id="n48276" type="main" key="Thy_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qunoi/,</foreign> <sense id="n48276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who emigrated to Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 43, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 7</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48276.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Thyni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thynian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Bithyna negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n48276.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳ-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the Thyni in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48276.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Thyniac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Euxine in Thrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48276.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳnĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thynian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>: grata domus Nymphis umida Thyniasin (<case>dat.</case> Graec.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 34</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 20, 12</bibl>, Dryasin, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 20, 32</bibl>, Hamadryasin).— </sense><sense id="n48276.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 412</bibl></cit> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
thynnarius: <entryFree id="n48277" type="main" key="thynna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thynnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. thunnarius.</entryFree>
thynnus: <entryFree id="n48278" type="main" key="thynnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thynnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. thunnus.</entryFree>
thynus: <entryFree id="n48279" type="main" key="Thy_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thȳnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Thyni, A.</entryFree>
thyone: <entryFree id="n48280" type="main" key="Thy^o_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*quw/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n48280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of the fifth Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enumerated in</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48280.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyōneus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Thyone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indetonsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semeleius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48280.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Thyone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13 praef.</bibl> —<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyotes: <entryFree id="n48281" type="greek" key="thy^o_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">quw/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:438" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 438</bibl></cit> (perh. as <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
thyraeus: <entryFree id="n48282" type="greek" key="thy^raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qurai=os,</foreign> <sense id="n48282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a door</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <trans><tr>the god of the entrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mil. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
thyre: <entryFree id="n48283" type="main" key="Thy^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qu/rh,</foreign> <sense id="n48283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little town in the Peloponnesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the possession of which was contested by the Argives and the Lacedæmonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 48</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thy-rĕātis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thyreatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>the region of Thyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:663" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 663</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thyreum: <entryFree id="n48284" type="main" key="Thyre^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrĕum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Acarnania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Leucas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thyreum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyroma: <entryFree id="n48285" type="greek" key="thy^ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/rwma,</foreign> <sense id="n48285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a door</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyrsagetae: <entryFree id="n48286" type="main" key="Thyrsa^ge^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrsăgĕtae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thyssăgĕtae</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thussăgĕtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asiatic Sarmatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Wolga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:140" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrsagĕtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:135" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyrsiculus: <entryFree id="n48287" type="main" key="thyrsi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyrsĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>thyrsus</etym>, <sense id="n48287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stalk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyrsiger: <entryFree id="n48288" type="main" key="thyrsi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyrsĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>thyrsusgero</etym>, <sense id="n48288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing the thyrsus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bacchic staff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 110" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">India,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 753" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thyrsis: <entryFree id="n48289" type="main" key="Thyrsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyrsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qu/rsis,</foreign> <sense id="n48289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyrsus: <entryFree id="n48290" type="greek" key="thyrsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thyrsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qu/rsos,</foreign> <sense id="n48290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi> of a plant. </sense><sense id="n48290.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:81" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 8, 41, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 33, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:370" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 370</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48290.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48290.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A staff twined round with ivy and vine-shoots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">borne by Bacchus and the Bacchantes; the Bacchic staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thyrsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 542</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 712</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7</bibl>; 9, 641; 11, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:614" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 614</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 904" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 904</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 628 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 628 al.</bibl> — Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., </sense><sense id="n48290.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A thorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acri Percussit thyrso laudis spes magna meum cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:923" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 923</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thyssagetae: <entryFree id="n48291" type="main" key="Thyssa^ge^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thyssăgĕtae</orth>, v. Thyrsagetae.</entryFree>
tiara: <entryFree id="n48292" type="greek" key="ti^a_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭāra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭāras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tia/ra</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">tia/ras,</foreign> <sense id="n48292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the head-dress of the Orientals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a turban</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tiara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectam capite tiaram gerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:31:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrumque sacerque tiaras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 247</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:700" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 700</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:516" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:267" default="NO">10, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiaratus: <entryFree id="n48293" type="hapax" key="ti^a_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭārātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tiara</etym>, <sense id="n48293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing a turban</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbaned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="TIBI" /></sense></entryFree>
tibarani: <entryFree id="n48294" type="main" key="Tibara_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibarāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Cili</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon Mount Amanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibareni: <entryFree id="n48295" type="main" key="Ti^ba^re_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbărēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum or ūm</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tibarhnoi/,</foreign> <sense id="n48295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Black Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:10" default="NO">1, 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:148" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibereius: <entryFree id="n48296" type="main" key="Ti^be^re_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tiberius, II. 3.</entryFree>
tiberianus: <entryFree id="n48297" type="main" key="Ti^be^ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tiberius, II. 2.</entryFree>
tiberinis: <entryFree id="n48298" type="main" key="Ti^be^ri_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrīnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Tiberis, I. B.</entryFree>
tiberinus: <entryFree id="n48299" type="main" key="Ti^be^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrīnus</orth>, v. Tiberis, I. A.</entryFree>
tiberis: <entryFree id="n48300" type="main" key="Ti^be^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, also contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Ty-bris</orth>), <itype>is or ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48300.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river Tiber</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tevere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis antea Tybris appellatus et prius Albula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n48300.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form Tiberis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 453 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9</bibl>; 30, 38; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 29, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 292</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 19</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48300.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form Tibris (Tybris; <cit><quote lang="la">only in the poets), Verg A. 2, 782: Tibrim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thybridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 810</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibride,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 127</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48300.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Tībrī-nus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 75</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiberine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:329" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 449</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>taken in the Tiber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 182</bibl></cit>: pater, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Father Tiber</hi>, as a river-god, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 55 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 369</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48300.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭ-bĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n48300.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Tiber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac quondam Tiberinus iter faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:291" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 291</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48300.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Alba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after whom the river is said to have been named</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 29 and 71 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:389" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 614</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48300.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrīnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiberine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nym phae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:597" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 597</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48300.8" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tybris</orth>), <hi rend="ital">the river-god Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 421</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiberius: <entryFree id="n48301" type="main" key="Ti^be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48301.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a Roman prænomen</hi> (abbrev. Ti.); as, Ti. Sempronius Gracchus, Ti. Claudius Asellus, Ti. Claudius Nero.—</sense><sense id="n48301.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the emperor Tiberius</hi> (whose full name is Ti. Claudius, Ti. F. Nero).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48301.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕ-rĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-rĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiberian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48301.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiberian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus S. C.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of which Tiberius was particularly fond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48301.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbĕrēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tiberius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tibi: <entryFree id="n48302" type="main" key="ti^bi_^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭbī^</orth>, v. tu.</entryFree>
tibia: <entryFree id="n48303" type="main" key="ti_bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the large shin-bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tibia</hi> (cf. sura). </sense><sense id="n48303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (os) a priore parte positum, cui tibiae nomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et in crure (recedit) tibia a surā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48303.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the shin-bone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leg</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse fieri ut genu esset aut tibia aut talus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistram fregit tibiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48303.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi> (orig. made of bone; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. fistula): age tibicen, refer ad labias tibias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibiae inflatae non referant sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51</bibl></cit>. 192: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum tibicen sine tibiis canere non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fidibus et tibiis canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus tibiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia digitis pulsata canentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulate canentes tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septenarios ad tibiam fundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi curva choros indixit tibia Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biforem dat tibia cantum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia non ut nunc orichalco vincta tubaeque Aemula, sed tenuis simplexque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygio curva sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub cantu querulae tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Berecyntia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1, 23: sonante mixtum tibiis carmen lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adunco tibia cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infracto Berecynthia tibia cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:698" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 698</bibl></cit>: scienter tibiis cantasse, Nep. praef. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl>: dextera tibia alia quam sinistra, perh. <hi rend="ital">treble and bass pipes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; cf.: modos fecit Flaccus Claudii <pb n="1871" /> <cb n="TIBU" /> filius; tibiis paribus dextris et sinistris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at first with a pair of treble and then with a pair of bass pipes</hi>, Didasc. Ter. And.; cf.: acta primum tibiis imparibus, deinde duabus dextris, id. Heaut.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 618</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. Dict. of Antiq. s. v.—Prov.: paene apertis, ut aiunt, tibiis,</quote> <trans><tr>from all the holes</tr>, <tr>with a loud voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
tibialis: <entryFree id="n48304" type="main" key="ti_bi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tibia</etym>. <sense id="n48304.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the shin-bone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tibia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tibial;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tībĭāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a warm wrappage about the shins</hi>, a kind of <hi rend="ital">stockings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leggings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hieme feminalibus et tibialibus muniebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si miles tibiale vel umerale alienavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:14:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 14, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48304.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the flute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo tibialis calami,</quote> <trans><tr>used for flutes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibialis aura gemit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tibiarius: <entryFree id="n48305" type="gloss" key="ti_bi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pipe-maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4292</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibicen: <entryFree id="n48306" type="main" key="ti_bi_cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībīcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from tībĭĭcen, from tibia-cano</etym>, <sense id="n48306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flutist.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, tibicen, refer ad labias tibias, suffla celeriter tibi buccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibiae non referant sonum, abiciendas sibi tibicen putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:192" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicen sine tibiis canere non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>; id Leg. 2, 24, 62; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47</bibl> 123; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 415</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicines abierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus celebratum ... praecedente tibicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl>: transit idem jurisconsultus tibicinis Latini modo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">preludes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rehearses the legal formulas</hi> (as the flutist accompanies the actors), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sing. collect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro tibicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">prop</hi> of a building, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:695" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem colimus tenui tibicine fultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 193</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of Atlas, supporting the heaven,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibicines in aedificiis dici existimantur a similitudine tibiis canentium, qui ut cantantes sustineant, ita illi aedificiorum tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tibicina: <entryFree id="n48307" type="main" key="ti_bi_ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībīcĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tibicen</etym>, <sense id="n48307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female fluteplayer</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> Müll. (p. 175 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 36 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 56</bibl>; id Most. 4, 3, 2 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:687" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 687</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibicinator: <entryFree id="n48308" type="gloss" key="ti_bi_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībīcĭnātor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">au)lhth/s,</foreign> Gloss. Cyrill. [tibicino].</entryFree>
tibicinium: <entryFree id="n48309" type="main" key="ti_bi_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībīcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tibicen</etym>, <sense id="n48309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playing upon the pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluting</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibicinii scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">342, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibicino: <entryFree id="n48310" type="main" key="ti_bi_ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībīcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n48310.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To play upon the pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo tibicinantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48310.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> any thing, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibigensis: <entryFree id="n48311" type="main" key="Tibigensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibigensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town Tibiga</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Numidia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tibilis: <entryFree id="n48312" type="main" key="Tibilis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibilis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 128" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 128</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibilitā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Tibilis</hi>: aquae, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.</sense></entryFree>
tibinus: <entryFree id="n48313" type="hapax" key="ti_bi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tibia</etym>, <sense id="n48313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>: modi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibricola: <entryFree id="n48314" type="main" key="Tibri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibrĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Tibris-colo</etym>, <sense id="n48314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller by the Tiber</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 4, 174.</sense></entryFree>
tibrinus: <entryFree id="n48315" type="main" key="Ti_bri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tībrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tiberis, I. A.</entryFree>
tibris: <entryFree id="n48316" type="main" key="Tibris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tibris</orth>, <itype>is and idis</itype>, v. Tiberis.</entryFree>
tibullus: <entryFree id="n48317" type="main" key="Ti^bullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭbullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Albius, <sense id="n48317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman elegiac poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born about</hi> 700 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">died about</hi> 735, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and friend of Ovid and Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibulus: <entryFree id="n48318" type="main" key="ti_bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tībŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pine-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 17, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tibur: <entryFree id="n48319" type="main" key="Ti_bur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tībur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Latium on both sides of the Anio</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tivoli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiburque superbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 630</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuum,</quote> <trans><tr>quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:32" default="NO">4, 64, 32</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48319.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburs</orth>, <itype>urtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiburtine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">SENATVS POPVLVSQVE TIBVRS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 113</bibl></cit> and 3728: <cb n="TIGE" /> hostis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliotheca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburs</orth>, <itype>urtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Tiburtine territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiburti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>; for which: in Tiburte, Glaucia ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 1</bibl>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tiburtines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 87, § 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 6</bibl> and 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 757</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1817</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3114</bibl>; 3851. — </sense><sense id="n48319.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tī-burtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiburtine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 85: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 80, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 48, § 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:57:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 57, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>leading from the Esquiline gate towards Tibur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tībur-tīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Tiburtine villa</hi> (of Scipio): <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiburtino Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48319.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tiburtine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 23</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Tiburnian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 74</bibl>; also, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n,</foreign> for Tiburtus, <hi rend="ital">the founder of Tibur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tiburtus: <entryFree id="n48320" type="main" key="Ti_burtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīburtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the founder of the town of Tibur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 671</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 87, § 237</bibl> (al. in each passage Tiburnus).</sense></entryFree>
tichius: <entryFree id="n48321" type="main" key="Tichi^u_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tichĭūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the summits of Mount Œta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tichobates: <entryFree id="n48322" type="greek" key="ti_cho^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tīchŏbătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teixoba/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wall-climber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ticida: <entryFree id="n48323" type="main" key="Ti^ci^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭcĭda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭcĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obscene Latin poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 279, 26</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48323.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A knight of Cæsar</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s party</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 44; 46.</sense></entryFree>
ticinensis: <entryFree id="n48324" type="main" key="Ti_ci_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīcīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Ticinus, B.</entryFree>
ticinum: <entryFree id="n48325" type="main" key="Ti_ci_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīcīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on the river Ticinus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pavia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ticinus: <entryFree id="n48326" type="main" key="Ti_ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīcīnus</orth> (scanned Tĭcīnus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 552</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Ticinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the victory of Hannibal over the Romans</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ticino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 39, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 45, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:81 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 81 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:706" default="NO">6, 706</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:31" default="NO">7, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 6, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48326.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Ticinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ticinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:548" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 548</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48326.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīcī-nensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ticinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <trans><tr>lying on the Ticinus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tifata: <entryFree id="n48327" type="main" key="Ti_fa_ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīfāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain ridge north of Capua</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Maddaloni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:219" default="NO">13, 219</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl>. — Hence, ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīfātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tifata</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tifatinian</hi>: DIANA, Inscr. Rein. cl. 6, n. 91; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 446, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48328" type="gloss" key="Ti_fa_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīfāta</orth> iliceta. Romae autem Tifata curia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n48328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tifatinus: <entryFree id="n48329" type="gloss" key="Ti_fa_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tīfātīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Tifata.</entryFree>
tifernum: <entryFree id="n48330" type="main" key="Tifernum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tifernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of three towns of Italy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48330.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Tifernum Tiberinum, <hi rend="ital">near the mod. Citta di Castello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants are called</hi> Tifernates Tiberini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48330.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A second town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Metaurus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Angelo in Vado</hi>, whose inhabitants, to distinguish them from the preceding, are called Tifernates Metaurenses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48330.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the mountain and river Tifernus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the mod. Limosani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 14, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tifernus: <entryFree id="n48331" type="main" key="Ti^fernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭfernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48331.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which was the town of Tifernum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Matese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 30, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48331.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river flowing by it</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Biferno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tigellinus: <entryFree id="n48332" type="main" key="Ti^gelli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭgellīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tĭgil-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <sense id="n48332.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in full: Tofonius Tigellinus,</quote> <trans><tr>a favorite of Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit> sqq.; 14, 57; 15, 50; 16, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 155</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">he committed suicide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tigellius: <entryFree id="n48333" type="main" key="Ti^gelli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭgellĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two musicians.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48333.1" n="I" level="1"> The more ancient, Tigellius Sardus, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 4</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48333.2" n="II" level="1"> The more modern, Tigellius Hermogenes, <hi rend="ital">a censurer of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 25</bibl>; 1, 10, 18; 1, 10, <cb n="TIGR" /> 80; 1, 10, 90; cf. Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tigillum: <entryFree id="n48334" type="main" key="ti^gillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭgillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tignum</etym>. <sense id="n48334.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small piece of wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamat suam rem perisse ... de suo tigillo fumus si qua exit foras,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if the least bit of wood is burned in his house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48334.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a little beam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48334.2" n="B" level="2"> Sororium Tigillum; v. sororius, II.</sense></entryFree>
tigillus: <entryFree id="n48335" type="main" key="Ti^gillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭgillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tigillum</etym>, <sense id="n48335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who sustains and holds the world like a beam</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 11.</sense></entryFree>
tignarius: <entryFree id="n48336" type="main" key="tigna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tignārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tignum</etym>, <sense id="n48336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beams</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber,</quote> <trans><tr>a carpenter</tr>, <tr>builder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4087 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabros tignarios dicimus non eos duntaxat, qui tigna dolant, sed omnes, qui aedificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 22, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tignum: <entryFree id="n48337" type="main" key="tignum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tignum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n48337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form, <number>plur.</number> tigni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 4</bibl>; but Weissenb. reads tigno) [root tek-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/tekon, ti/ktw,</foreign> whence <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh, te/ktwn,</foreign> texo], <hi rend="ital">building-stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building-materials</hi> (syn. trabs). </sense><sense id="n48337.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class. and in jurid. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">tigni appellatione in lege duodecim tabularum omne genus materiae, ex quā aedificia constant, significatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:62" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tigni autem appellatione continetur omnis materia, ex quā aedificium constat vineaeque necessaria. Unde quidam aiunt, tegulam quoque et lapidem et testam ceteraque, si qua aedificiis sunt utilia (tigna enim a tegendo dicta sunt) hoc amplius et calcem et harenam tignorum appellatione contineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 3</bibl></cit> (de tigno juncto), 1.—</sense><sense id="n48337.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stick of timber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trunk of a tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beam</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">venit imber ... Tigna putrefacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna trabesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 192</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra eum locum duo tigna transversa injecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et levia radere tigna Et terebrare etiam ac pertundere perque forare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna bina sesquipedalia in flumen defixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquet ingens machina tignum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo quae pendet aranea tigno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 648</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 50.</sense></entryFree>
tigranes: <entryFree id="n48338" type="main" key="Ti_^gra_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tī^grānes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48338.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Armenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Mithridates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 3</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:43" default="NO">4, 12, 43</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His son</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Mil. p. 47" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Mil. p. 47</bibl> Orell.; Schol.
