cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in purpurā istā aliud quam victoriarum mearum titulos geris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulo Spartanae victoriae inflatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captae urbis titulo cedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48451.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciconia, titulus tepidi temporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48451.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason alleged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi> (so perh. not ante-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, nomen): non vos pro Graeciae libertate tantum dimicare: quamquam is quoque egregius titulus esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetendere titulum belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 54, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestiorem causam libertatis quam servitutis praetexi titulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 59, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub titulo aequandarum legum nostra jura oppressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub honorificentissimo ministerii titulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (probabatur) accepisse HS. decem milia foedissimo quidem titulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfugae titulo Babyloniam proficiscitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat hic quidem titulus cum Graecis coëundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:10" default="NO">11, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:13" default="NO">15, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulum sollemnis officii occulto sceleri praeferentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">titulus facinori speciosus praeferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48451.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The title</hi> of a book (post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">index): M. Tullius in ipsis librorum quos hac de re primum scripserat titulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam (libri) ex titulo cognosces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui vix voluminum suorum frontes maxime placent titulique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
titurianus: <entryFree id="n48452" type="main" key="Ti^tu_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtūrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Titurius.</entryFree>
titurius: <entryFree id="n48453" type="main" key="Titu_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Titūrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a legate of Cæsar in the Gallic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 25</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtūrĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Titurius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Titurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
titurnius: <entryFree id="n48454" type="main" key="Titurni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Titurnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
titus: <entryFree id="n48455" type="main" key="Ti^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prænomen</hi>, abbreviated T.</sense></entryFree>
tityos: <entryFree id="n48456" type="main" key="Ti^ty^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭtyos</orth>, <itype>yi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tituo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Apollo with arrows for his attempt on the chastity of Latona; and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a further punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as he lay in the infernal regions stretched out over a space of nine</hi> jugera, <hi rend="ital">a vulture kept feeding on his liver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was as constantly reproduced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:992 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 992 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:75" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tityrus: <entryFree id="n48457" type="main" key="Ti_ty^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tītyrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48457.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a shepherd in Virgil</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s Eclogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48457.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48457.2" n="A" level="2"> For <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48457.3" n="B" level="2"> As a designation of <hi rend="ital">Virgil</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s Eclogues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 25</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48457.4" n="C" level="2"> As a designation of <hi rend="ital">Virgil</hi> himself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 72.</sense></entryFree>
tityus: <entryFree id="n48458" type="main" key="Tity^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tityus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tlepolemus: <entryFree id="n48459" type="main" key="Tle_po^le^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tlēpŏlĕmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tlhpo/lemos,</foreign> <sense id="n48459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leader of the Rhodians before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 81:97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 81, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 537</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tmaros: <entryFree id="n48460" type="main" key="Tma^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmărŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 44</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏ-mărus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmă-rĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tmaros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tmarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tmesis: <entryFree id="n48461" type="greek" key="tme_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tmēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tmh=sis,</foreign> in grammar, <cb n="TOGA" /> <sense id="n48461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the separation of a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tmesis</hi> (as, Saxo cere comminuit brum; v. cerebrum <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 412</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tmolus: <entryFree id="n48462" type="main" key="Tmo_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmōlus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĭmōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tmw=los,</foreign> <sense id="n48462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Lydia in which the Pactolus rises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing excellent wines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kisilja Mousa Dagh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 217</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 151</bibl> sq.— <cit><quote lang="la">Form Timolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48462.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town near Mount Tmolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48462.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small river flowing from Mount Tmolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 43, § 126</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48462.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmōlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tmolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tmolian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmōlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mons), <hi rend="ital">Mount Tmolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48462.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tmō-lītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Tmolus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">the wine of Tmolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tmolian wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toculio: <entryFree id="n48463" type="hapax" key="to^cu^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏcŭlĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏcullĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">to/kos,</foreign> usury</etym>, <sense id="n48463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a usurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te in toculionibus habebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
todi: <entryFree id="n48464" type="gloss" key="todi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">todi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: todi genus avium parvarum. Plautus: cum todillis crusculis, Fest. pp. 352 and 353 Müll.</entryFree>
toecharchus: <entryFree id="n48465" type="greek" key="toecharchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">toecharchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">toi/xarxos,</foreign> <sense id="n48465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the commander of the rowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tofaceus: <entryFree id="n48466" type="main" key="to_fa_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōfācĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tofus</etym>, <sense id="n48466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of tufa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tufaceous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
toficius: <entryFree id="n48467" type="hapax" key="to_fi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōfĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like tufa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tufaceous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tofinus: <entryFree id="n48468" type="hapax" key="to_fi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōfīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of tufa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metae (circi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tofosus: <entryFree id="n48469" type="hapax" key="to_fo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōfōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like tufa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tufaceous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verruca umore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tofus: <entryFree id="n48470" type="main" key="to_fus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōfus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tōphus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tufa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tuff;</hi> Ital. <hi rend="ital">tufo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 122" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 562</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:52" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toga: <entryFree id="n48471" type="main" key="to^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n48471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48471.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (ante-class. and rare): praeterea quod in lecto togas ante habebant; ante enim olim fuit commune vestimentum et diurnum et nocturnum et muliebre et virile, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 541, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incinctā togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 540:33" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 540, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comic.: ne toga cordylis, ne paenula desit olivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n48471.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A roofing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(toga) dicitur et tectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 406, 21</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48471.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the outer garment of a Roman citizen in time of peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and consisting of a single piece of stuff; the toga</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gown.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48471.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quod pacis est insigne et otii toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tenues decuere togae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:88:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 88, 4</bibl></cit>: toga praetexta, <hi rend="ital">the toga of magistrates and free-born children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented with purple;</hi> v. praetexo: toga pura, <hi rend="ital">the unornamented toga of youth who had laid aside the</hi> praetexta: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceroni meo togam puram cum dare Arpini vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called more freq. virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 2</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">toga libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 132; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:771" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 771</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a patre ita eram deductus ad Scaevolam sumptā virili togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga picta,</quote> <trans><tr>worn by a victor in his triumph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurea,</quote> <trans><tr>worn by kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 12</bibl>: candida, <hi rend="ital">the toga worn by candidates for office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of white fulled cloth;</hi> v. candidus: pulla, <hi rend="ital">the dark-gray toga of mourners;</hi> v. pullus; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 107 sq.; 2, pp. 55 and 74 sq. (2d edit.).—</sense><sense id="n48471.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48471.6" n="1" level="3"> As a designation for <hi rend="ital">peace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo genere haec sunt, Liberum appellare pro vino, campum pro comitiis, togam pro pace, arma ac tela pro bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl></cit>: cedant arma togae, id. poët. Off. 1, 22, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omnibus belli ac togae dotibus eminens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>.—Also of the <hi rend="ital">Roman national character;</hi> hence, togae oblitus, <hi rend="ital">forgetful of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48471.7" n="2" level="3"> As, in the times of the emperors, the toga went more and more out of use, and became almost exclusively the garment of clients, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a client</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eheu quam fatuae sunt tibi Roma togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47:5" default="NO">10, 47, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:65" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:32" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 32</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48471.8" n="3" level="3"> As women of loose character were not allowed to wear the proper female garment (the stola), and assumed the toga, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a prostitute</hi>: si tibi cura togae est <pb n="1876" /> <cb n="TOLE" /> potior pressumque quasillo Scortum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
togatarius: <entryFree id="n48472" type="hapax" key="to^ga_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgātārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>togatus</etym>, <sense id="n48472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an actor in the</hi> Fabula togata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl> (al. togatarum).</sense></entryFree>
togatulus: <entryFree id="n48473" type="main" key="to^ga_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgātŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>toga, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n48473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man of humble station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little client</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:24:11" default="NO">11, 24, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
togatus: <entryFree id="n48474" type="main" key="to^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>toga</etym>, <sense id="n48474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing the toga</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clad in the toga</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gowned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fovebit Romanos, rerum dominos, gentemque togatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut togatus mandata senatus audiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48474.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a private station</hi>: sportula turbae rapienda togatae, <hi rend="ital">by the crowd of clients</hi> (cf. toga, II. B. 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <trans><tr>the service of a client</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 46, 1</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48474.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, lit., <hi rend="ital">a Roman citizen</hi>, opp. to a foreigner or to a Roman soldier: <cit><quote lang="la">judex modo palliatus modo togatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui uni togato supplicationem decreverit (senatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus e togatorum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna caterva togatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas in togatos,</quote> <trans><tr>to Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pudet lictorum vestrorum majorem prope numerum in foro conspici quam togatorum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter togatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the time of the emperors togati seems to have been the designation of the citizens, in opposition to the plebs sordida, the tunicati,</quote> <trans><tr>the third class</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Roth in Jahn's Neues Jahrb. 1858, vol. 77, p. 286 sq.—</sense><sense id="n48474.3" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to toga, II. B. 2.) Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a man of humble station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a client</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48474.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fabula), <hi rend="ital">a species of the Roman drama which treated of Roman subjects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the national drama</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 487</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 21</bibl>; cf. Com. Rel. p. 113 sq. Rib.—</sense><sense id="n48474.5" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to toga, II. B. 3.) Togata, <hi rend="ital">of an immodest woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prostitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48474.6" n="III" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia Togata,</quote> <trans><tr>the part of Gallia Cisalpina acquired by the Romans on the hither side of the Po</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:24:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:52:1" default="NO">8, 52, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
togula: <entryFree id="n48475" type="main" key="to^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little toga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">togulae lictoribus praesto fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trita quidem nobis togula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:101:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 101, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tolerabilis: <entryFree id="n48476" type="main" key="to^le^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tolero</etym>. <sense id="n48476.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that may be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae si tolerabiles erunt, ferendae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabilis conditio servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc utcumque tolerabile: gravius illud quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regi tolerabili, aut, si vultis, etiam amabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minucius jam ante vix tolerabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tolerabile numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabilius est sic dicere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 18</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48476.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can easily bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustaining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. tolerabiliter, 2.): homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (oves) ille tempore auctumni ratus adhuc esse tolerabiles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>able to support the winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrābĭ-lĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n48476.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bearably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:85" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare veratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48476.3" n="2" level="3"> For toleranter, <hi rend="ital">patiently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim si dolores eosdem tolerabilius patiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 13, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabilius ferre igniculum desiderii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tolerabiliter: <entryFree id="n48477" type="main" key="to^le^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tolerabilis <sense id="n48477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tolerans: <entryFree id="n48478" type="main" key="to^le^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of tolero.</entryFree>
toleranter: <entryFree id="n48479" type="main" key="to^le^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tolero <sense id="n48479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tolerantia: <entryFree id="n48480" type="main" key="to^le^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tolero</etym>, <sense id="n48480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum humanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax vel incuriā vel tolerantiā priorum timebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toleratio: <entryFree id="n48481" type="hapax" key="to^le^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>. <cb n="TOLI" /></sense></entryFree>
tolerator: <entryFree id="n48482" type="main" key="to^le^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tolero</etym>, <sense id="n48482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who endures</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 99:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 99, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toleratus: <entryFree id="n48483" type="main" key="to^le^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of tolero.</entryFree>
tolero: <entryFree id="n48484" type="main" key="to^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n48484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 800</bibl> P.) [lengthened form of the root tol, whence tollo and tuli, kindr. with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*t*l*a*w</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (syn.: fero, patior, sustineo, sino). </sense><sense id="n48484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare and mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquilae ipsae non tolerantes pondus apprehensum una merguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sinu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremio suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 154, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">mensula cenae totius honestas reliquias tolerans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 121, 26.—</sense><sense id="n48484.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicunt illi dolorem esse difficile toleratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:19:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus et tributa civitatum ab omnibus tolerari aequabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: acritudinem, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile labores pericula, dubias atque asperas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo animo servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 301</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vaporis vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:630" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta peditum equitatumque vis damnaque et injuriae aegre tolerabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim aestumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo longius tolerari posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse ipsam Liviam statuere, nubendum post Drusum an in penatibus isdem tolerandum haberet,</quote> <trans><tr>continue</tr>, <tr>remain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48484.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): ferro se caedi quam dictis his toleraret, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 137 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui perpeti medicinam toleraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudinem mali perferre visu non toleravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n48484.4" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania imbres tempestatesque tolerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:173" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 14, 49, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerat et annos metica (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48484.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to support</hi> a person or thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> by food, wealth, etc., = sustentare (v. h. v. II. B. 1.; <cit><quote lang="la">so not in Cic.): his rationibus equitatum tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octona milia equitum suā pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fructibus agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:203" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semetipsos (pisces clausi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 409</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:64:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut toleret (sc. erum amantem servus), ne pessum abeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48484.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium obnixum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 1</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48484.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerant</hi> (post-Aug.; mostly with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus laborum tolerans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium genera dulcis undae tolerantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca frigoris tolerantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello tolerantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus plagarum et penuriae tolerantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕran-ter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n48484.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Patiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n48484.9" n="2" level="3"> For tolerabiliter, <hi rend="ital">bearably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc anniculae fecunditatem poscuntur, tolerantius tamen bimae,</quote> <trans><tr>moderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48484.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">supportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut clementiam ac justitiam, quanto ignara barbaris, tanto toleratiora capesseret,</quote> <trans><tr>acceptable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 11</bibl></cit>.† † <orth extent="full" lang="la">toles</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tolles</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a wen on the neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goitre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 16, 289</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
toletum: <entryFree id="n48485" type="main" key="To^le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Toledo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:30" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 30</bibl>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Toletum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 34</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Toletum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tolistobogii: <entryFree id="n48486" type="main" key="Tolistobogii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tolistobogii</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tolost-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Galatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose precise home is unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 15</bibl> (Weissenb. Tolostobogiorum); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:11:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 11, 5</bibl>. <cb n="TOLL" /></sense></entryFree>
tolleno: <entryFree id="n48487" type="main" key="tolle_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tollēno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tollo</etym>, in mechanic. and milit. lang., <sense id="n48487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swing-beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swape</hi>, e. g. to raise a water-bucket from a well, or to raise a body of men to a level with the enemy's ramparts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. reciprocare, p. 274 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:320 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 320 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tolles: <entryFree id="n48488" type="main" key="tolles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tolles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. toles.</entryFree>
tollo: <entryFree id="n48489" type="main" key="tollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tollo</orth>, <itype>sustŭli, sublātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n48489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> tollit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 4, 13</bibl></cit>) [root Sanscr. tul-, tulajāmi, lift up, weigh; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tal-, tel,</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">tlh=nai, ta/lanton;</foreign> cf.: tuli, tlātus (latus), tolerare], <hi rend="ital">to lift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, always with the predom. idea of motion upwards or of removal from a former situation. </sense><sense id="n48489.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exalt</hi>, etc. (syn.: effero, elevo). </sense><sense id="n48489.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48489.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: unus erit quem tu tolles in caerula caeli templa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 66 Vahl.): pileum ad caelum tollit, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor ibi ad caelum se tollit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 325</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: aliquem tollere in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Herculem) in caelum ista ipsa sustulit fortitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollam ego ted in collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthon optavit, ut in currum patris tolleretur: sublatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos in crucem sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in crucem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">13: aquila in sublime sustulit testudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arduos Tollor Sabinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me hic jacentem aliquis tollat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: mulum suum tollebat Fufius, <hi rend="ital">lifted up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised up</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo caput tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustulimus manus et ego et Balbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: scorpius caudā sublatā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica convolvit sublato pectore terga (coluber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tollere a terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis e speculā sublatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 93</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48489.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48489.5" n="a" level="4"> Tollere liberos, <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledge;</hi> and so, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi> as one's own (from the custom of laying new-born children on the ground at the father's feet; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">suscipio): quod erit natum, tollito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 33</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 67 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">natum filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nothum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 3, 14</bibl>.—Also of the mother: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod peperissem, id educarem ac tollerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48489.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beget</hi> a child: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex Fadiā sustulerit liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decessit morbo aquae intercutis, sublato filio Nerone ex Agrippinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n48489.7" n="b" level="4"> Nautical t. t.: tollere ancoras, <hi rend="ital">to lift the anchor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh anchor;</hi> esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatis ancoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48489.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> out of the nautical sphere, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vultis ancoras tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48489.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollam altius tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si juxta habeas aedificia, eaque jure tuo altius tollas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48489.10" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take on board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, of vessels or vehicles: <cit><quote lang="la">navem, metretas quae trecentas tolleret, parasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, quae equites sustulerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera navis ducentos ex legione tironum sustulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 54: tollite me, Teucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se sublatum in lembum ad Cotym deveheret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas me tollere raedā vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Talem te Bacchus ... sustulit in currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 157</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48489.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48489.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, etc.: tollitur in caelum clamor exortus utrimque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 422 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem in caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamores ad sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 222</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor magnus se tollit ad auras,</quote> <trans><tr>rises</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor a vigilibus tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cachinnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 381</bibl></cit>: litterulae meae tui desiderio oblanguerunt: hac tamen epistulā oculos paulum sustulerunt, <hi rend="ital">have opened</hi> <pb n="1877" /> <cb n="TOLL" /> <hi rend="ital">their eyes again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have reanimated them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 2</bibl>.—Esp. with <hi rend="ital">animos</hi>: ne in secunda tollere animos et in mala demittere, <hi rend="ital">to elevate</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 286, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>, <tr>animate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubium est quin omnis Hispania sublatura animos fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. abicere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:28:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dicendo augere et tollere altius (opp. extenuare et abicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad caelum te tollimus verissimis ac justissimis laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum illud, quod tu tollere laudibus solebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit> (14): <cit><quote lang="la">nostras laudes in astra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daphnim tuum ad astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergeminis tollere honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos Tempe tollite laudibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. also Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">supra modum se tollens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se eadem geometria tollit ad rationem usque mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO">1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum Tollere (i. q. consolari),</quote> <trans><tr>to cheer up</tr>, <tr>console</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48489.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take on one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">providere non solum quid oneris in praesentia tollant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Apollodorus poenas sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48489.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take up</hi> a thing from its place, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make way with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away with one</hi> (syn.: aufero, adimo). </sense><sense id="n48489.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48489.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum de areā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem e mundo tollere videntur, qui amicitiam e vitā tollunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquis nos deus ex hac hominum frequentiā tolleret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra ex delubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias e fano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeram ex urbe (Syracusis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his sublatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam tolli jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me per hostes Denso paventem sustulit aëre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet sublata reponi Pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum me tolle per undas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque tolle simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollite me, Libyes, comitem poenaeque necisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:500" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 500</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48489.17" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48489.18" n="a" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to take off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make away with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ferro, veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titanas fulmine (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: quem febris una potuit tollere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 406, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me truncus illapsus cerebro Sustulerat, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollet anum vitiato melle cicuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorbitio tollit quem dira cicutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri Carthaginem et Numantiam funditus sustulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>laid waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ademptus Hector Tradidit fessis leviora tolli Pergama Graiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—In a play with I. B. supra: te dixisse, laudandum adulescentem (Caesarem), ornandum, tollendum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se non esse commissurum, ut tolli posset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48489.19" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: tollere signa, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi> for marching, <hi rend="ital">to decamp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 57, 1.—</sense><sense id="n48489.20" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to do away with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove; to abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cancel</hi> (very freq., esp. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: oblittero, aboleo): rei memoriam tollere ac delere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatā benevolentiā amicitiae nomen tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum ornamentum amicitiae tollit, qui ex eā tollit verecundiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librariorum menda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut id nomen ex omnibus libris tollatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres leges novis legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictaturam funditus ex re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublato Areopago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <trans><tr>to deny the existence of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to consume in speechmaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus facile tollitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dolores et tumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 75, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeditates cicatricum maculasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebrem luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">elated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quo proelio sublati Helvetii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac victoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 38</bibl></cit>: quibus omnibus rebus, id.
