B. <cb n="TOMU" /> C. 2, 37: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidens magis et sublatior ardet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 54</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sublātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">highly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftily.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n48489.21" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus diebus centum sublatius fluens, minuitur postea,</quote> <trans><tr>higher</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48489.22" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublate ampleque dicere (opp. attenuate presseque),</quote> <trans><tr>loftily</tr>, <tr>with elevation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:201" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatius dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>more proudly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:36:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 36, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublatius insolescentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tolosa: <entryFree id="n48490" type="main" key="To^lo_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlōsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Toulouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:100:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 100, 3</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n48490.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlōsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tolosa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tolosan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>plundered by the consul Q. Servilius from Tolosa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlōsāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tolosa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tolosans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48490.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlōsas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tolosa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tolosan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cathedra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlō-sātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tolosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48490.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlōsensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tolosa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tolosan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tolostobogii: <entryFree id="n48491" type="main" key="Tolostobogii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tolostobogii</orth>, v. Tolistobogii.</entryFree>
tolumnius: <entryFree id="n48492" type="main" key="To^lumni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏlumnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the Veientes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Rutulian soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 429</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 258</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tolutaris: <entryFree id="n48493" type="main" key="to^lu_ta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. tolutarius.</entryFree>
tolutarius: <entryFree id="n48494" type="main" key="to^lu_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tolutim</etym>, <sense id="n48494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going on a trot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trotting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 9</bibl></cit>.— Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, in the trop. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae tolutares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Or. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tolutilis: <entryFree id="n48495" type="hapax" key="to^lu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">going on a trot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trotting</hi>: gradu vectus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tolutiloquentia: <entryFree id="n48496" type="hapax" key="to^lu_ti^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tolutim-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n48496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talking on a trot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volubility</hi>: o pestifera . . . trux tolutiloquentia, Nov. ap. Nen. 4, 7 (Com. Rel. p. 220 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tolutim: <entryFree id="n48497" type="main" key="to^lu_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏlūtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from the root tol, whence tollo, tolero, tŭli; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*t*l*a*w;</foreign> prop. lifting up the feet; hence, pregn.</etym>, <sense id="n48497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on a trot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full trot</hi> (mostly ante - class.): cedit citu', celsu' tolutim, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of horses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 67, § 166</bibl>: ire tolutim, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni tolutim badizas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tomacina: <entryFree id="n48498" type="hapax" key="to^ma_ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏmācĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">tomh/,</foreign> a cutting up</etym>, <sense id="n48498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sausage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; cf. tomaculum.</sense></entryFree>
tomaculum: <entryFree id="n48499" type="main" key="to^ma_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏmācŭlum</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, contr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏmā-clum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">tomh/,</foreign> a cutting in pieces</etym>, <sense id="n48499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sausage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably similar to our brain- or liver-sausage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:355" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 355</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art., and cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 193 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
tomarus: <entryFree id="n48500" type="main" key="To^ma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmărus</orth>, i. v. Tmaros.</entryFree>
tome: <entryFree id="n48501" type="greek" key="to^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tomh/,</foreign> <sense id="n48501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation;</hi> in metre, <hi rend="ital">the cæsura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2440" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2440</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tomentum: <entryFree id="n48502" type="main" key="to_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stuffing</hi> for cushions (e. g. of wool. hair, feathers, straw, etc.), <hi rend="ital">cushioning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 1, 2, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:88" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 10, 61, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 23 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:159" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 159</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> 14, 160 <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> 14, 162; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276, 14</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 240 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
tomex: <entryFree id="n48503" type="main" key="to_mex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. thomix.</entryFree>
tomis: <entryFree id="n48504" type="main" key="To^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*to/mis</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*to/moi,</foreign> <sense id="n48504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Mœsia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pontus Euxinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous as the place to which Ovid was banished.</hi>—Form Tomis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 33</bibl>.—Form <itype>Tŏmi, ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:254" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 254</bibl>; Claud. Epith. Pall. et Celer. 70; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 159</bibl>.—And after the Greek orthog., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmoe</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48504.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tomis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 85</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48504.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tomis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tomitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:6:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:8:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tomix: <entryFree id="n48505" type="main" key="to_mix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōmix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. thomix.</entryFree>
tomoe: <entryFree id="n48506" type="main" key="To^moe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmoe</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Tomis.</entryFree>
tomus: <entryFree id="n48507" type="greek" key="to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to/mos.</foreign> <sense id="n48507.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bit</hi>: vilis, <hi rend="ital">a cheap piece</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">roll of paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 67, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48507.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48507.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tome</hi> of a larger work: feci excerpta ex libris sexaginta in quinque tomis, M. Aurel. ap. Front, <cb n="TONI" /> Ep. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 2, 13</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48507.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a book</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe tibi tomum magnum novum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tomyris: <entryFree id="n48508" type="main" key="To^my^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏmyris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*to/mupis,</foreign> <sense id="n48508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian queen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by whom the elder Cyrus was defeated and slain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:143" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10</bibl>, ext. 1.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămyris</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tămĭris</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thămyris</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonans: <entryFree id="n48509" type="main" key="to^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. tono <sense id="n48509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tondeo: <entryFree id="n48510" type="main" key="tonde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tondĕo</orth>, <itype>tŏtondi, tonsum, 2</itype> (collat. form acc. to the third conj.: OVES TONDVNTVR, Calend. ap. Grut. 138), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for tomdeo; root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnw,</foreign> to cut</etym>, <sense id="n48510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shave</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n48510.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam et capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 443</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 257</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naevos in facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 6, § 34</bibl></cit>: saltatrix tonsa, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with hair clipped short</hi> (of the Consul Gabinius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl>; cf.: tonsus puer or minister, <hi rend="ital">cropped</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:11:3" default="NO">11, 11, 3</bibl>: ad alta tonsum templa cum reum misit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">acquitted</hi> (prop. without the untrimmed hair of accused persons), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:74:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 74, 3</bibl>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">lavamur et tondemur et convivimus ex consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tonsori collum committeret, tondere filias suas docuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl></cit>.—And in reflex. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">ut decrescente lunā tondens calvus fiam,</quote> <trans><tr>shaving myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior postquain tondenti barba cadebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48510.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48510.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille comam mollis jam tondebat hyacinthi,</quote> <trans><tr>was cropping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violas manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem in pollicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas, vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilicem bipennibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48510.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsas cessare novales patiere,</quote> <trans><tr>after harvest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte arida prata Tondentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tondeturque seges maturos annua partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:172" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsam verrit humum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 130" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 130</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48510.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to graze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">browse upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat off; to pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cull</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ex uno tondentes gramina campo Lanigerae pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula (pecudes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumeta (juvenci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum late (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridantia gramina morsu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tondentes comam fluvii capellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur rostro (vultur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales avida fecundum jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Greek constr.: illa autem, quae tondetur praecordia rostro Alitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:839" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 839</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48510.6" n="D" level="2"> As in Engl., <hi rend="ital">to shave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleece</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to deprive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">adibo hunc . . . itaque tondebo auro usque ad vivam cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tondens purpureā regna paterna comā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 18), 22.</sense></entryFree>
tonesco: <entryFree id="n48511" type="hapax" key="to^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n48511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [tono], <hi rend="ital">to resound</hi>: caelitum altum tonitribus templum tonescit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 180, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tongere: <entryFree id="n48512" type="main" key="tonge_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tongēre</orth> <itype>Aelius Stilo ait noscere esse</itype>, quod Praenestini tongitionem dicant pro notione. Ennius: <sense id="n48512.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">alii rhetoricam tongent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl></cit> Müll. (Sota, v. 4 Vahl. p. 165).</sense></entryFree>
tongitio: <entryFree id="n48513" type="main" key="tongi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tongĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>onis</itype>, v. tongere.</entryFree>
tonitralis: <entryFree id="n48514" type="spur" key="to^ni^tra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnĭtrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, a false read. for penetralia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1105</bibl>.</entryFree>
tonitru: <entryFree id="n48515" type="main" key="to^ni_^tru"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnī^tru</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, v. tonitrus.</entryFree>
tonitrualis: <entryFree id="n48516" type="hapax" key="to^ni^tru^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnĭtrŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tonitrus</etym>, <sense id="n48516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thundering</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, App. de Mundo, p. 75, 6.</sense></entryFree>
tonitruo: <entryFree id="n48517" type="main" key="to^ni_^tru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnī^trŭo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus tonitruat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psa. 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonitrus: <entryFree id="n48518" type="main" key="to^ni_^trus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnī^trus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnī^trŭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n48518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> tonitrui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 3, 17</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tono</etym>, <hi rend="ital">thunder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48518.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrum auribus accipiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:171" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrum audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitruum terribile exsistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:54:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:56:1" default="NO">2, 56, 1</bibl>: auditum praeterea tonitruum, Treb. Gall. 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 6</bibl>: veri tonitrūs similitudinem imitari, Fest. s. v. Claudiana, p. 57 Müll.: caelum tonitru contremit, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru caelum omne ciebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitruque tremescunt Ardua terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 694</bibl></cit>.—The <case>nom.</case> tonitru, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, rests solely on the authority of grammarians, Fest. s. v. pecuum, p. 246 Müll.; Serv. Verg. <pb n="1878" /> <cb n="TONS" /> A. 5, 694; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 624</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">685</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">714</bibl> P. al.; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 350 sq.— </sense><sense id="n48518.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (form tonitra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. 480" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. 480</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tum fulgores et tonitrua exsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 117</bibl>: clamor tonitruum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito coorta tempestas cum magno fragore tonitribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 3, 13, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 496</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:20:1" default="NO">20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere tonitrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrus agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:258" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres et tonitrus fieri derepente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tono: <entryFree id="n48519" type="main" key="to^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype> (collat. form of third conj.: tonimus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 21</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root in Sanscr. tan-, to stretch, extend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/nw;</foreign> whence teneo, tendo, tenus; cf. O. H. Germ. donar; Engl. thunder], <hi rend="ital">to thunder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48519.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ingens Porta tonat caeli, Enn. ap. Vet. Gram. ap. Col. (Ann. v. 597 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 261</bibl>: cum tonuit laevum bene tempestate serenā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl> (Ann. v. 517 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut valide tonuit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fulserit, si tonuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove tonante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonans Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub axe tonanti Sternitur aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater nudā de rupe tonabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si consulto fulmina missa tonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 54: <cit><quote lang="la">Diespiter per purum tonantes Egit equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, tona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 5:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48519.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n48519.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a loud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thundering noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crash</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crepo, strepo): tympana tenta tonant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna horrificis ruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum omne fragore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 541</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 757</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus afflicta massa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:612" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus fragore vasto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 173" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:69:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 69, 4</bibl>.—Of loud, thundering speech: <cit><quote lang="la">Pericles fulgere, tonare, dictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. praef. § 30: qualis Pindarico spiritus ore tonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 383</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48519.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thunder forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">name with a thundering voice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tercentum tonat ore deos,</quote> <trans><tr>invokes with thundering voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 134: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia celso ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicerona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos>, as epithet of Jupiter: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the thunderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">god of thunder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 466</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolinus Tonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptriferi Tonantes, Jupiter and Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 59</bibl></cit>.—Also of Saturn: <cit><quote lang="la">falcifer Tonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonor: <entryFree id="n48520" type="main" key="to^no^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, old form of tenor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl>.</entryFree>
tonsa: <entryFree id="n48521" type="main" key="tonsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from tundo</etym>, <sense id="n48521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oar</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; mostly in <number>plur.</number>; syn. remus). </sense><sense id="n48521.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: in mari magno tenere tonsam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll. (Sota, v. 3 Vahl. p. 164): <cit><quote lang="la">valida tonsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:369" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 369</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48521.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 232; 235; 236 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 299</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:448" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 448</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:492" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 492</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 443 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 443 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
tonsicula: <entryFree id="n48522" type="main" key="tonsi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tonsa</etym>, <sense id="n48522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a small fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsilis: <entryFree id="n48523" type="main" key="tonsi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n48523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be shorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">clipped.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48523.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">villus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitas piceae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48523.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for tonsus, <hi rend="ital">shorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clipped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lopped</hi>: tapetes, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">buxetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsilla: <entryFree id="n48524" type="main" key="tonsilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsilla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tosilla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n48524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sharppointed pole which was stuck in the ground to fasten vessels to the shore</hi>, Pac. and Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Trag. Fragm. v. 218" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Trag. Fragm. v. 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Fragm. v. 517" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Fragm. v. 517</bibl> Rib.). — </sense><sense id="n48524.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsillae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the tonsils</hi> in the throat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsio: <entryFree id="n48525" type="main" key="tonsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n48525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shearing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lanae ex ovium tonsione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; id. Amos, 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
tonsito: <entryFree id="n48526" type="hapax" key="tonsi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsor: <entryFree id="n48527" type="main" key="tonsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsor</orth> (TOSOR, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 214</bibl>, n. 546), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n48527.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shearer, clipper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaver</hi> <cb n="TOPI" /> of the hair, beard, nails, etc., <hi rend="ital">a hair-cutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 59, 59, § 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 301</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:57:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 57, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84:2" default="NO">11, 84, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2883</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">a shearer of sheep: ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 136 (2d edit.).—Of a <hi rend="ital">nail-cutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsor ungues dempserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: omnibus et lippis notum et tonsoribus esse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be known to every body</tr>, <tr>to all the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48527.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clipper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lopper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruner</hi>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum luxuriantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsorius: <entryFree id="n48528" type="main" key="tonso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n48528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to shearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tonsorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culter,</quote> <trans><tr>a razor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 36</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultellus,</quote> <trans><tr>for cutting nails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta,</quote> <trans><tr>for shearing sheep</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tonstricula: <entryFree id="n48529" type="main" key="tonstri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonstrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tonstrix</etym>, <sense id="n48529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little female hair-cutter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl>; cf. tonstrix.</sense></entryFree>
tonstrina: <entryFree id="n48530" type="main" key="tonstri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonstrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n48530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barber</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:114" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 36, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:112" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 37, § 112</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 136 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
tonstrinum: <entryFree id="n48531" type="main" key="tonstri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonstrīnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-einum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the act</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calling of a barber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonstrix: <entryFree id="n48532" type="main" key="tonstrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonstrix</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsrix</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 30</bibl> P.), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female hair-cutter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 594, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsura: <entryFree id="n48533" type="main" key="tonsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clipping; a pruning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trimming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam in anno bis tondent (oves) ac semestres faciunt tonsuras,</quote> <trans><tr>wool - shearings</tr>, <tr>shearings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 45, § 257</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:175" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 37, 68, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonsus: <entryFree id="n48534" type="main" key="tonsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tondeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48535" type="main" key="tonsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tonsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n48535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mode of dressing the hair</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pes, statura, tonsus, oculi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 288</bibl></cit>: mulier tonsu lugubri, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tonus: <entryFree id="n48536" type="greek" key="to^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to/nos.</foreign> <sense id="n48536.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The stretching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straining</hi> of a rope: <cit><quote lang="la">mollior, vehementior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 10, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48536.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48536.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>, of an instrument, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 959</bibl>.—Of the tone of a syllable, <hi rend="ital">accent</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48536.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48536.4" n="1" level="3"> Like our <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>, in painting, of the natural color of an object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48536.5" n="2" level="3"> For tonitrus, <hi rend="ital">thunder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 56, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toparcha: <entryFree id="n48537" type="greek" key="to^parcha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏparcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">topa/rxhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the governor of a territory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a toparch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toparchia: <entryFree id="n48538" type="greek" key="to^parchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏparchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">toparxi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toparchy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 14, 15, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 11, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
topaziacus: <entryFree id="n48539" type="greek" key="to^pa_zi^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpāzĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">topaziako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to topaz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">topaz-</hi>: lapilli, Ven. Carm. 8, 6, 273.</sense></entryFree>
topazos: <entryFree id="n48540" type="main" key="to^pazo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpazŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-zus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 1021</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">to/pazos,</foreign> <sense id="n48540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ancient topaz</hi>, a <hi rend="ital">chrysolite</hi> or <hi rend="ital">green jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 32, § 107</bibl>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 8, 5, 272; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Vit. Mart. 3:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vit. Mart. 3, 517</bibl>. — Collat. forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpazĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏpazĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 16, 41; 16, 42; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 9, 9</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏpazōn</orth>, <itype>ōntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 861</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tophus: <entryFree id="n48541" type="main" key="to_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and its derivv., v. tofus.</entryFree>
topia: <entryFree id="n48542" type="greek" key="to^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. opera) [<foreign lang="greek">to/pos</foreign>]. <sense id="n48542.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Landscape painting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48542.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ornamental gardening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy gardening</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
topiarius: <entryFree id="n48543" type="main" key="to^pi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>topia, II.</etym>, <sense id="n48543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to ornamental gardening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gardening</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>used for borders in gardens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48543.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48543.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ornamental gardener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy gardener</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:242" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 26, 65, § 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2966</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4293</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 27 (2d edit.). —</sense><sense id="n48543.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), <hi rend="ital">ornamental</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fancy gardening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the topiary art</hi>, i. e. that of giving fanciful forms to thickets, trees, etc., of laying out parterres. forming arbors,<cb n="TORM" />  bowers, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48543.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. opus), <hi rend="ital">fancy gardening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">topiary - work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 265</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
topias: <entryFree id="n48544" type="main" key="to^pi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭas fīcus</orth>, <sense id="n48544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a particular species of fig-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
topica: <entryFree id="n48545" type="greek" key="To^pi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏpĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*topika/,</foreign> <sense id="n48545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Aristotle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which a compend is given by Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
topice: <entryFree id="n48546" type="main" key="to^pi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">topikh/,</foreign> <sense id="n48546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of finding topics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
topos: <entryFree id="n48547" type="greek" key="to^po^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏpŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to/pos,</foreign> <sense id="n48547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place</hi> (pure Lat. locus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 968</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
topper: <entryFree id="n48548" type="main" key="topper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">topper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from toto opere</etym>, <sense id="n48548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with all diligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi> (anteclass.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ultimis et jam oblitteratis repetita temporibus, qualia sunt topper et antigerio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl></cit>): topper citi ad aedes venimus Circae, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=352" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 352</bibl> Müll.; so Naev., Enn., Att., Cael. ib.</sense></entryFree>
toral: <entryFree id="n48549" type="main" key="to^ral"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏral</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrāli</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. p. 46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. p. 46</bibl> Bip.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>torus</etym>, <sense id="n48549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a valance</hi> of a couch; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Orell. 2270; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 247 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
toranius: <entryFree id="n48550" type="main" key="To_rani^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tōranĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*twra/nios,</foreign> <sense id="n48550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slavedealer at the time of the second Triumvirate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toraria: <entryFree id="n48551" type="hapax" key="to^ra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (torus = <foreign lang="greek">w)le/nh</foreign>], = <foreign lang="greek">w)le notro/fos,</foreign> <sense id="n48551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female waiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torcular: <entryFree id="n48552" type="main" key="torcu^lar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym>. <sense id="n48552.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A press</hi> used in making wine or oil, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 230</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48552.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cellar for storing up oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an oil-cellar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:10" default="NO">12, 52, 10</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torcularius: <entryFree id="n48553" type="main" key="torcu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torcular</etym>, <sense id="n48553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a press</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48553.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48553.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a presser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48553.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = torcular, I., <hi rend="ital">a press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torculo: <entryFree id="n48554" type="hapax" key="torcu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, Ven. 5, 6 praef.</sense></entryFree>
torculum: <entryFree id="n48555" type="main" key="torcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. torculus, II.</entryFree>
torculus: <entryFree id="n48556" type="main" key="torcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torcular</etym>, <sense id="n48556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a press</hi>, = torcularius. </sense><sense id="n48556.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 68</bibl></cit>; 135, 3.—</sense><sense id="n48556.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">torcŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = torcular, I., <hi rend="ital">a press</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 7</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tordylion: <entryFree id="n48557" type="greek" key="tordy^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tordylĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tordylon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tordu/lion</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">to/rdulon,</foreign> acc. to some, <sense id="n48557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the seed of the plant</hi> seselis; acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hartwort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tordylium officinale or maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:177" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 117, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tores: <entryFree id="n48558" type="hapax" key="to^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = torques, <sense id="n48558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain</hi>: aureus, Serv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 118</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
toreuma: <entryFree id="n48559" type="greek" key="to^reuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏreuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to/reuma,</foreign> <sense id="n48559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">work executed in relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embossed work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 52, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:16" default="NO">10, 87, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:102:2 al" default="NO">14, 102, 2 al.</bibl> — <hi rend="ital">Dat. plur.</hi> toreumatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 7, p. 344 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
toreuta: <entryFree id="n48560" type="greek" key="to^reuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏreuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">toreuth/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes embossed work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chaser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toreutice: <entryFree id="n48561" type="greek" key="to^reuti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏreutĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">toreutikh/,</foreign> <sense id="n48561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of making embossed work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sculpture</hi> ( = caelatura), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 77</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">(Phidias) primus artem toreuticen aperuisse judicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 270 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
torini: <entryFree id="n48562" type="main" key="Torini"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Torini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Scythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:148" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tormentum: <entryFree id="n48563" type="main" key="tormentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tormentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>torqueo, an instrument with which any thing is turned or twisted</etym>. <sense id="n48563.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An engine for hurling missiles.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48563.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentis Mutinam verberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinator bellicorum tormentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:279" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48563.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a missile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shot</hi> thrown by the engine: <cit><quote lang="la">quod unum genus tegumenti nullo telo neque tormento transici posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">telum tormentumve missum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; 3, 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48563.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> (twisted) <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope</hi>: praesectis<pb n="1879" /> <cb n="TORO" />  crinibus tormenta effecerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces tormentis introrsus reducebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 19:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 19, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuppeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 276, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fetters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine tormentorum injuriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48563.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument of torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rack.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48563.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus ac tormentis quaestionem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere de aliquo tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 63, 176 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:10" default="NO">3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu lene tormentum ingenio admoves,</quote> <trans><tr>a rack of a mild sort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48563.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatus et tormenta pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tormento liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">the torture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pain of sickness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:27" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 4, 13, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:79" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 37, § 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: caecae suspitionis, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā Siculi non invenere tyranni Majus tormentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:137" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibiles cruciatus et indignissima tormenta pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentum sibi injungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 86, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene tormentis secubituque coli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">the pain of love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:29:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentis gaudet amantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:209" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi tormenta latentis in aegro Corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48563.7" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clothes-press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
